wowinfo: Nothing really happened, wow-related, at the 31st of any month. Oh well!
September 2001: The game, World of Warcraft, was announced at London European Computer Trade Show.
December 2004: Patch 1.2.0 is released, adding the Maraudon Dungeon, the Gurubashi Arena, and the Feast of Winter Veil Christmas event.

November 2004: World of Warcraft launches in North America, Australia, and New Zealand. To give a general idea of what classic was: The starting level cap for players was level 60. The starting races were Human, Dwarf, Night Elf, Gnome, Orc, Troll, Undead, and Tauren. The starting classes were Druid, Hunter, Priest, Rogue, Warrior, Warlock (Shaman for Horde and Paladin for Alliance). And the only raids in the game were Onyxias Lair and Molten Core.
November 2004: WowWiki, a great source of information for anything WoW-related, launches.
June 2005: World of Warcraft launched in China, alongside with Patch 1.5.0. This patch includes the introduction of battlegrounds with Warsong Gulch and Alterac Valley.
March 2005: Patch 1.3.0 is released, adding the Dire Maul dungeon, new outdoor raid bosses Azuregos and Lord Kazzak, meeting stones to summon players, and player caps on dungeons/raids.

April 2005: Patch 1.4.0 is released, adding the Player versus Player battle system (implementing rankings based on performances), Children's Week event, Elemental invasions and the Gurubashi Arena event.

October 2005: Patch 1.8.0 is released, fixing the corrupted blood debuff, while adding the Dragons of Nightmare and the Abyssal High Council world bosses, the Hallow`s End Halloween event, and the Stirring of the Silithid event.

May 2005: The guild PalsForLife uploaded a video to the World of Warcraft fansite, Warcraft Movies. In the video, you can see the guild discussing battle strategies when suddenly a paladin named Leeroy Jenkins charged into the area, wiping the group. This was the start of the LEEEROOYYYYYYYY JENKINS meme.
February 2005: World of Warcraft launches in Europe.

July 2005: Patch 1.6.0 is released, adding the Blackwing Lair raid instance, the introduction of the carnival-esque darkmoon faire, and Battlemasters, which were an easier way to enter the battleground queues.

September 2005: Patch 1.7.0 is released, adding the Zul'Gurub raid instance, the Arathi Basin battleground, and the Stranglethorn Fishing Extravaganza event. Yet, something was starting to occur as a result of a glitch in Zul'Gurub.

September 2005: The Corrupted Blood incident occurred. The corrupted blood debuff, which originated from Hakkar the Soulflayer in the Zul'Gurub raid instance, would periodically sap a player's life and would spread to other players. The glitch occurred when a player's pet would get the debuff and would retain the debuff as it was summoned in highly populated areas and cities, spreading the debuff and killing thousands of characters. Think virus epidemic but much cooler and online.
November 2005: World of Warcraft is featured in a question on the game show, Jeopardy! None of the three players knew the answer, or even tried to guess.
January 2005: World of Warcraft launches in South Korea!
August 2005: The World of Warcraft Trading Card Game (WoW TCG) was announced by Upper Deck Entertainment.
November 2005: The popular news site and blog, WoW Insider was launched.
March 2005: The first legendary item appears to players in the game. The legendary neck piece,[Talisman of Binding Shard], drops in the Molten Core raid, but was immediately hotfixed out of the game.
April 2005: The guild Ascent-US accomplishes a World-First and slays Ragnaros the Fire Lord in Molten Core. He was taken from us too soon, Executus.
April 2005: World of Warcraft open beta test launches in China, with 100,000 players signing up in the first hour of registration.
September 2005: The son of Deathwing, Nefarian, was slain by the guild Drama, from Shattered Hand-US, for the first time in his Blackwing Lair.

October 2005: The first ever Blizzcon took place at the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was at this convention where the Burning Crusade expansion was announced. Attendees of the convention received a beta key for the Burning Crusade expansion, alongside with a Murky" battle pet."
March 2005: Patch 1.10.0 is released, adding weather effects to areas around Azeroth, linked flight paths, and upgrades to armor sets.

October 2005: The first ever Blizzcon took place at the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was at this convention where the Burning Crusade expansion was announced. Attendees of the convention received a beta key for the Burning Crusade expansion, alongside with a Murky" battle pet."
January 2005: Onyxia falls at the hands of the guild Ruined, from Proudmoore-US, marking today as the first raid boss kill in the game.

January 2006: Patch 1.9.0 is released, adding the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj world event (which unlocked the Ruins/Temple of Ahn'Qiraj dungeon and raid, respectively), multiple battleground queues, raid calendar timers/resets, and faction-linked auction houses.
October 2006: South Park features a Warcraft-themed episode, Make Love, not Warcraft.
December 2006: Patch 2.0.1 is released, adding a looking for group interface tool, an honor system revamp for PvP, and PvP arenas.
July 2006: The Wowhead website launched.
September 2006: The floating necropolis Naxxramas loses its master, Kel'Thuzad, at the hands of Nihilum from Magtheridon-EU. He shall return though.
December 2006: The Burning Crusade cinematic trailer is released.
June 2006: Patch 1.11.0 is released, adding a sixth bag slot which held a number of keys and the naxxramus raid instance, alongside the scourge invasion event.
August 2006: Patch 1.12.0 is released, adding cross-realm battlegrounds and world PvP objectives.
January 2006: Medivh-US becomes the first server to open the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj.

October 2006: The World of Warcraft Trading Card Game was officially released! Players can fight against each other one-on-one, or can join others in order to defeat dungeon/raid bosses based on those in the MMORPG. These card packs also could contain a redeemable in-game mount, if you are lucky.
April 2006: The Elder God of Horror, C'Thun, was ended by the guild Nihilum, from Magtheridon-EU, accomplishing a World-First. His whispers soon end throughout the halls of Ahn'Quiraj.

March 2006: World of Warcraft player Deluthor creates a Flash animation to accompany the audio recording of the guild Wipe Club and their rather boisterous leader Dives. This is where the -50 DKP meme originated from.
April 2006: the WoWRP website, which is a community driven website for people playing on role-play servers, is launched.

August 2007: Blizzcon takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was this convention where the Wrath of the Lich King expansion was announced. Attendees were given a beta key to an upcoming Blizzard game and a special in-game murloc suit.
February 2007: Gruul the Dragonslayer was....slayed in his own lair by the hands on Nihilum from Magtheridon-EU. Man Nihilum was on a roll.

August 2007: Blizzcon takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was this convention where the Wrath of the Lich King expansion was announced. Attendees were given a beta key to an upcoming Blizzard game and a special in-game murloc suit.
June 2007: Illidan Stormrage was not prepared to deal with Nihilum from Magtheridon-EU and fell from the top of the Black Temple.
January 2007: Patch 2.0.3 is released, adding the pre-expansion event, the Dark Portal Opens, where Highlord Kruul begins attacking places in Azeroth.
June 2007: The decisive Battle of Mount Hyjal ends with Archimonde, as Nihilum of Magtheridon-EU has slain one of the top-ranked commanders of the Burning Legion.

November 2007: Patch 2.3.0 is released, adding the Zul'Aman raid instance, guild banks, revamps to Alterac Valley, Level 11-60 leveling improvements, and the Mudsprocket quest hub at Dustwallow Marsh.

January 2007: The Burning Crusade expansion is released! The level cap was raised to 70, the area of Outland was added, and the Draenei and Blood Elf races were added. Shaman and Paladins became available for both factions, as heroic mode instances and the Eye of the Storm battleground was added.

January 2007: The launch of the expansion was plagued by server crashes and a huge percentage of the player base questing in Hellfire Peninsula, all at the same time. Yet this expansion is marked by selling nearly 2.4 million copies in the first 24 hours, becoming the fastest-selling PC game ever!
January 2007: Gawell of the Millenium guild, from Archimonde-EU, reached level 70 for the first time ever. It took him a total of 28 hours and no sleep to accomplish this.
November 2007: Blizzard advertises World of Warcraft on television with ads featuring William Shatner as a Shaman and most notably Mr. T talking about his Night Elf Mohawk.
May 2007: Patch 2.1.0 is released, adding the Black Temple raid instance, multiple faction reputations, and the Ruins of Lordaeron Arena.
February 2007: The demon Magtheridon returns to the Twisting Nether at the hands of Nihilium from Magtheridon-EU.
May 2007: Pretty sure Tempest Keep was merely a setback, but Kael'thas Sunstrider loses his life to Nihilum of Magtheridon-EU, claiming another World-First kill.
September 2007: Patch 2.2.0 is released, adding voice chat functionality.
March 2007: Nihilum shows their dominance once more and ends Lady Vashj`s reign within the Serpentshrine Cavern, accomplishing yet another World-First kill.
April 2008: The server Proudmoore-US becomes the first server to complete the Shattered Sun Offensive.
August 2008: World of Warcraft`s Recruit-a-Friend program is introduced, granting awards to whoever brings their friends into the world of Azeroth.
August 2008: World of Warcraft launches in Russia, along with the Burning Crusade expansion.

November 2008: The undead Scourge begin to attack Stormwind City and Orgimmar on a regular basis. These attacks seem too coordinated, as if they are just mindless soldiers following their kings orders.

November 2008: The fabled Wrath of the Lich King expansion is released! The level cap for all players is increased to 80, as the icey realms of Northrend can now be visited/explored. Alongside 2 new battlegrounds, a bunch of new dungeons, and 2 returning (but updated) raids, the new Death Knight class was introduced.

October 2008: Patch 3.0.2 is released, adding a 61-point talent tree system, the inscription profession, an achievement system, the barber shop feature to change ones appearances, and the second scourge invasion event (the first being in patch 1.11 that heralded the opening of Naxxramas). In preparation for Wrath of the Lich King, original Naxxramas raid and the city of Dalaran was removed, Alliance boats were rerouted, Stormwind Harbor was added, and New Horde Zeppelin Towers were added.
September 2008: The Wrath of the Lich King finally gets a released date for November, 13th 2008.
November 2008: Malygos, one of the few remaining dragons of the Blue Dragonflgiht, falls into the endless abyss by Ensidia of Tarren Mill-EU.
November 2008: Kel'Thuzad`s return is met with the same fate, as the guild Ensidia from Tarren Mill-EU clears the Return of the Floating Necropolis.
July 2008: Patch 2.4.3 is released, reducing the level required to ride mounts to level and adding items sold by Haris Pilton (including a 22 slog bag).
July 2008: Wrath of the Lich King beta tests commence.
August 2008:The Wrath of the Lich King cinematic is released.
October 2008: The Zombie Infestation begins the start of the Second Scourge Invasion. Think corrupted blood incident but on purpose.
November 2008: Any players logging onto World of Warcraft are awarded a [Baby Blizzard Bear] pet and the Achievement WoWs 4th Anniversary"."

October 2008: The Zombie Infestation looks pretty bad right now. Capital cities are the main target for the zombies, but the NPCs should have no problem dealing with them...At least that is what i keep hearing. You do not see much leveling these days. I mean who would ever want to go out at a time like this. I am sure the Heroes of Azeroth are coming up with a plan.
March 2008: Patch 2.4.0 is released, adding the Isle of Quel'Danas area, the Magister`s Terrace dungeon, the Sunwell Plateau raid instance and the Shattered Sun Offensive.

May 2008: The Deceiver, Kil'Jaeden falls within the Sunwell Plateau, with the aid of SK Gaming of Vek'nilash-EU. This is one of the few times, at least during/before the Burning Crusade, where Nihilium was not the first guild to beat the final boss.

October 2008: The Zombie Infestation only gets worse. Feels like 28 weeks later in the span of 3 days. Every capital city is full of mindless walkers, as the people are walled onto secluded areas of Azeroth, fighting for survival. Even if you do not see rampaging hordes, you see skeletons of the fallen, covering up roads and farmlands. Its only a matter of time before it all ends.
October 2008: The Zombie Infestation officially ends, as life goes back to the way it was.
June 2008: The original Authenticators become available in the Blizzard store. These served as an extra layer of protection for ones World of Warcraft account.
September 2009: The Faction Change service started to be offer.

August 2009: Patch 3.2.0 is released, adding the Crusaders` Coliseum dungeon, the Isle of Conquest battleground, and continues the Argent Tournament story line. The instance lock extension was added to the game, giving players the option to not reset the raid each week, and players can not access/buy mounts at level 20.
June 2009: Algalon the Observer changes the fate of our World at the base of Ulduar, thanks to the couragous actions of Ensidia from Tarren Mill-EU.
June 2009: World of Warcraft shuts down in China....huh. that happens.

December 2009: Patch 3.3.0 is released, adding the Icecrown Citadel raid (at least the BONESTORM-filled lower depths section of the raid), as well as the Frozen Halls dungeon. With the opening of this amazing dungeon, the dungeon finder was improved and cross-server instance grouping was implemented.
July 2009: The Traitor King of the Nerubians, Anub'arak, falls shortly at the hands of Paragon from Lightning Blade-EU beneath the Trial of the Crusader arena.
April 2009: Patch 3.1.0 is released, adding the Ulduar raid instance and the Argent Tournament. Along with typical class changes, dual talent specialization was introduced.
April 2009: Blizzard announces that they are changing their Chinese licensee from The9 to NetEase....for some reason.

May 2009: Blizzard, in partnership with Pepsi, commenced the Mountain Dew Choose Your Side" game fuel. This was essentially 2 new mountain dew flavors for the WoW major factions: wild berry for Alliance and citrus cherry for Horde."
September 2009: World of Warcraft relaunches in China under its new licensee, NetEase.
August 2009: The Mountain Dew Choose Your Side" promotion unfortunately ends. But on the bright side
column4: the World of Warcraft: The Magazine was announced."

wowinfo: August 2009: Blizzcon takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was this convention where the Cataclysm expansion was announced. Attendees were given Grunty, the Murloc Space Marine.
September 2009: Patch 3.2.2 is released, revamping the Onyxia raid boss in celebration of WoW`s 5th anniversary!
November 2009: All players who logged on are awarded the [Onyxian Whelpling] pet and the achievement WoW`s 5th Anniversary"."

August 2009: Blizzcon takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was this convention where the Cataclysm expansion was announced. Attendees were given Grunty, the Murloc Space Marine.
October 2009: The Race Change service started to be offered.

April 2009: WoW Insider heard rumors of a guild that had just cleared Naxxramas was savagely killing bosses in Ulduar in record times. Looking more into this, apparently a user named Karatechop was mistakenly-mailed a Game Master artifact called [Martin Fury] which can kill enemies within a 30 yard radius. In using this item, this was considered an exploit and the player was ultimately banned.

November 2010: Phase 1 of Elemental Unrest has commenced. The Elements have been disturbed and have started attacking Stormwind, Orgimmar, Ironforge, and Thunder Bluff, destroying the land and capturing citizens. Cultists have appeared and set up camp in areas, spouting doom and gloom.

March 2010: The guild Ensidia was able to slay the Lich King for the first time! Yet, due to the use of saronite bombs and applying siege damage to the platform, this world first was considered an exploit and ultimately did not count. This exploit becomes the most controversial topic in all of WoW, as the guild was not fully aware of what they were doing.
February 2010: Patch 3.3.2 is released, opening the final wing of Icecrown Citadel, the Frostwing Halls. The Lich King awaits!
May 2010: The Friends & Family phase of the World of Warcraft: Cataclysm alpha begins.
January 2010: Good News Everyone! The Plagueworks of Icecrown Citadel opens. Professor Putricide awaits!

November 2010: Blizzcon 2015 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. Previews of Legion content were covered in panels on the main stage as the expansion is still being made, but the most important part of this convention was the release of the Legion cinematic. Attendees received a goodie bag, rewarding a [Murkidan] mini-pet which resembles Illidan Stormrage.

July 2010: Blizzard announces their intention to have Real ID names visible when posting on the official forums. This resulted in a massive outcry against the idea, based primarily on concerns about privacy issues and potential harassment.

September 2010: The first in-game events, leading up to the Cataclysm expansion, begins. The Alliance got to take back the fallout-induced halls of the gnome capital in Operation: Gnomeregan, while the Horde and the Darkspear tribe, led by Voljin, got to take back the Echo Isles from the evil witch doctor in Zalazane`s Fall.
October 2010: World of Warcraft reaches 12 million players, for the first time and the all time record.

November 2010: Blizzcon 2014 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. Since the expansion is pretty close to release, there is not much news for WoW this time around. The convention focuses on their new IP, Overwatch and the movie Looking for Group". Attendees still got a goodie bag

December 2010: World of Warcraft: Cataclysm is released. The player level cap is raised to 85, the archaeology profession is added, and new races are added: the worgen and goblin. Instead of introducing a new continent, several zones were updated across azeroth. They also added new areas, Mount Hyjal, Uldum, Vash'jir, Tol Barad, Gilneas, Deepholm, and Twilight Highlands. And of course new dungeons, raids, my body, feel the strength of the EARTH!

November 2010: Phase 2 of Elemental Unrest has commenced. While elements still attack the area, doomsayers have starting walking around, shouting the end of the world. Meanwhile, a badly, injured adventurer is found, surrounded by scorched bodies of grunts and Twilight Hammer cultists.
August 2010: The Peoples Republic of China approves a heavily edited Wrath of the Lich King two years after its general release. Bones are a huge no-no in China.

November 2010: Phase 3 of Elemental Unrest has commenced. Cultist Infiltrators have arrived to summon powerful elementals, while Cultist Incanters have started to appear within the capital cities. Leaders have noticed this and are returning to their posts to fight off the cultists, detaining some.
February 2010: The Peoples Republic of China approves World of Warcraft: The Burning Crusade for release, three years after its release everywhere else.

October 2010: Patch 4.0.1 is released, updating the launcher for Cataclysm and introducing reforging. Alongside with a complete talent and ability overhaul for all classes, emblems, badges, marks of honor, and ammunition have been removed from the game!
November 2010: Phase 4 of Elemental Unrest has commenced. Elemental rifts now spawn with higher frequency, in an effort to overwhelming defending forces.

October 2010: All but one of WoWWikis active administrators leave Wikia forming Wowpedia. Over the next couple weeks, most of the active users follow. In a more positive note, the World of Warcraft: Cataclysm cinematic trailer is released. Parts of the trailer were aired on television in the second quarter of the Dallas Cowboys/Minnesota Vikings football game on the same day. The commercial asked, Where will you be when the Cataclysm begins?""
January 2010: Merely a Setback! The Crimson Hall of Icecrown Citadel opens. The blood queen awaits for fresh doses.

October 2010: Blizzcon takes place at the Anaheim Convention Center, California. All attendees received Deathy, the murloc that looks like Deathwing, as an in-game pet. It was here that Blizzard announced that the next expansion (Cataclysm) will be available for direct digital download, rather than having to buy a CD hard copy.
June 2010: Patch 3.3.5 is released in North America, adding Real ID and cross-game chat using Battle.net, as well as the Ruby Sanctum.

November 2010: Patch 4.0.3a is released, completely changing the landscape of the Eastern Kingdoms and Kalimdor. Trolls and Gnomes have finally obtained a starting area and new race/class combinations for existing races. Also, Upper Blackrock Spire was reworked into a 5 man dungeon.

October 2010: Blizzcon takes place at the Anaheim Convention Center, California. All attendees received Deathy, the murloc that looks like Deathwing, as an in-game pet. It was here that Blizzard announced that the next expansion (Cataclysm) will be available for direct digital download, rather than having to buy a CD hard copy.
March 2010: Patch 3.3.3 is released, as the random battleground system is implemented, and the honor system is overhauled to account for the removal of battleground Marks of Honor.

March 2010: Crptozoic Entertainment announced the acquisition of the games license after Upper Deck Entertainment lost the license from Blizzard, and discussed the planned card sets that would be released.
March 2010: The Lich King`s plans fail at the hands of Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU for the official" first time! Yet
column4: there must always be a Lich King..."

wowinfo: July 2010: Due the overwhelming flood of criticism, Blizzard rescinds their plan to put Real ID names on the official forums.
November 2010: All players logging in are awarded the achievement WoW`s 6th Anniversary"."
June 2010: Patch 3.3.5 is released to all other non-American servers. Cataclysm Beta Tests also commence.
February 2011: Patch 4.0.6 is released, which was just a tooltip display fix and class adjustment patch.
January 2011: The return of Deathwing`s son, Nefarian, fails once more and becomes a decaying pile in front of Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU within Blackwing Descent.
October 2011: Blizzard announces an auction for their old server hardware for charity, raising over $333,000 for the St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.
September 2011: Too bad! World of Warcraft: The Magazine closes after 5 issues. Subscribers were offered a refund or a collection of all six of the pets available from the Pet Store.
July 2011: Ragnaros is defeated in his own domain at the hands of Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU at heroic 25 man. It was still too soon.
January 2011: Deathwing`s former prime consort, Sinestra, meets a gruesome end, as the guild Paragon from Lightning`s Blade-EU strikes the final blow.
December 2011: Deathwing`s corpse sinks into the Maelstorm thanks to the heroic actions of KIN Raiders, from Kargath-KR! (This is considered the World First heroic kill)
November 2011: Players logging in are awarded WoW`s 7th Anniversary" and a [Celebration Package]
column4: which is a buff to a characters reputation and experience gained during the anniversary period."

wowinfo: October 2011: Blizzcon takes place at the Anaheim Convention Center California. It was here where the Mists of Pandaria expansion was announced. People who commit to a full year monthly subscription to World of Warcraft will receive: a free copy of Diablo 3, a Tyrael mount, and a guaranteed invitation to the Mists of Pandaria beta. Attendees received a Murkablo mini-pet.

October 2011: Blizzcon takes place at the Anaheim Convention Center California. It was here where the Mists of Pandaria expansion was announced. People who commit to a full year monthly subscription to World of Warcraft will receive: a free copy of Diablo 3, a Tyrael mount, and a guaranteed invitation to the Mists of Pandaria beta. Attendees received a Murkablo mini-pet.
January 2011: WIINNNNNDDDDDDSSSSS! Al'Akir was unfortunately silenced by the hands of 夢想 of TW-Silverwing Hold. (This achievement was for 10 man heroic difficulty)
January 2011: WIIIIIIIIIIINNNNNDDDDDDDDDS! Al'Akir falls from his Throne of the Four Winds by the might of Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU on 25 man heroic difficulty.
April 2011: Patch 4.1.0 is released, which is the big, bad Zandalari patch. Zul'Aman and Zul'Gurub return as level 85 5 man heroic dungeons.
January 2011: Blizzard files complaints with the online service PayPal in an effort to make payment difficult for gold sellers. Chinese gold diggers were a serious issue at the time.

June 2011: Patch 4.2.0 is released, adding the Firelands raid to kill Ragnaros at his homeland, as well as Fireland daily invasion quests. The legendary staff [Dragonwrath, Tarecgosa`s Rest] is added to the game while keyrings are removed (keys become obsolete now). Also the Burning Crusade is offered to all players at no additional cost.

November 2011: Patch 4.3.0 is released, adding Raid Finder, transmogrification, void storage, End Time, Well of Eternity, and the Hour of Twilight dungeon, and the Dragon Soul raid instance. Darkmoon Faire is also moved to Darkmoon Island and The Ghostcrawler promised me a pony" saying is immortalized ingame with the achievement "I Was Promised a Pony"."
October 2012: World of Warcraft is hacked on some servers, and both players and NPCs die en mass. Blizzard quickly hot-fixes this in a few hours and the issue is resolved.

October 2012: Paragon, from Lightning Blade-EU were able to surpass The Will of the Emperor within the Mogu'shan Vaults. This world first heroic kill, which was a 10 man, was the shortest recorded kill for any final boss in WoW. The raid lasted one day before it was fully completed.
October 2012: The sha-corrupted ruler of the mantid, Grand Empress Shek'zeer, is dethroned with the aid of Blood Legion from Illidan-US!
August 2012: The Mists of Pandaria cinematic trailer is released at GamesCom 2012.
November 2012: Players logging in are awarded WoW`s 8th Anniversary" and a [Celebration Package]."
March 2012: The Mist of Pandaria Beta begins.
July 2012: Blizzard announces the release date for the Mists of Pandaria expansion: September 25th.
November 2012: The Sha of Fear has been shown the one thing to fear most: Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU.

September 2012: The Mists of Pandaria expansion is released! The player level cap is raised to 90, as the continent of Pandaria was discovered and can now be explored. Upon its discovery, we can across the Pandaren race, as well as the Monk Class. The pet battle system was also introduced, as well as the scenario system and a bunch of dungeons (9 to be exact), world bosses, and 3 initial raid instances.

November 2012: Patch 5.1.0 is released, adding the Brawler`s Guild, item upgrading, the legendary questline, and the Pandaren Campaign begins with Operation: shieldwall and the Dominance Offensive for the Alliance and Horde, respectively.

August 2012: Patch 5.0.4 is released, adding Account-wide achievements, pets, and mount usage, cross-realm servers, AOE looting, and introducing the first scenario: Theramore`s Fall (Which was essentially Horde nukes an entire city" storyline)."

October 2013: The armies of the world have come for Garrosh Hellscream, facing all the terrible creatures he has wrought and the terrible power he has mastered! It was Method who rose against Hellscream`s new Horde and ended the new tryant`s reign for the first time in history!
March 2013: Patch 5.2 is released, adding the Throne of Thunder raid instance, the Isle of Thunder daily quest content/area, new world bosses, and continuation of the legendary questline.

November 2013: Blizzcon 2013 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was here that the Warlords of Draenor expansion was announced. Attendees received a Murkalot mini-pet, which resembles the crusader from Diablo 3.

December 2013: It is revealed that the United States NSA (National Security Agency) and the United Kingdoms GCHQ (Government Communications Headquarters) have been actively spying on MMORPGs, including World of Warcraft. It was revealed that a 2008 memo circulated at the NSA had called online gaming a target-rich communications network" where terrorists could communicate "in plain sight." HAHAHA"

November 2013: Blizzcon 2013 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. It was here that the Warlords of Draenor expansion was announced. Attendees received a Murkalot mini-pet, which resembles the crusader from Diablo 3.

September 2013: Patch 5.4 is released, introducing the Siege of Orgrimmar raid after Garrosh Hellscream takes matter into his own hands. The Timeless Isle, with 4 new world bosses, and the proving grounds are introduced. In this patch, raid difficulty was adjusted and changed to scale with the amount of players in the group, as well as the new personal loot system, connected realm implementation, and a redesigned arena system.
December 2013: Patch 5.4.2 is released, which basically introduced the In-Game Shop, where you can buy mounts, pets, and items without having to go to the Online Blizzard store.
April 2013: The creator of the Mogu and a secret Heroic Mode boss, Ra-Den, sleeps once more at his battle against Method, from Twisting Nether-EU, for the first time.
August 2013: Blizzard trademarks the title The Dark Below". With speculation over the past few months about the possibility of a Burning Legion expansion
column4: players are convinced we will soon be descending into the dark depths of Azeroth!

wowday: 17,2013,November 2013: Players logging in are awarded the "WoW`s 9th Anniversary" achievement and a [Celebration Package]."

wowinfo: May 2013: Patch 5.3 is released, re-adding item upgrading that was removed in Patch 5.2, as well as adding a new battleground, arena, and 4 new scenarios.
August 2013: It is announced that the World of Warcraft Trading Card Game will end with Set 21, Timewalkers: Reign of Fire being the last set made.
March 2013: Lei Shen, the Thunder King, is put back into his tomb at the hands of Paragon from Lightning's Blade-EU. (World First Heroic Kill)
September 2013: The first connected realm was implemented, in order to populate less popular servers, while saving space/time.
November 2013: Longtime Lead Systems Designer for World of Warcraft, Greg Ghostcrawler" Street announces he is leaving Blizzard Entertainment."
December 2014: Highmaul opens its gates for Normal and Heroic difficulty. Imperator awaits with his Ogron Army!
April 2014: Warlord of Draenor internal alpha testing begins!
June 2014: Warlords of Draenor friends and family alpha testing begins.
July 2014: Blizzard releases some comical extra footage" from the Mists of Pandaria cinematic
column4: featuring the human and orc characters drinking in a tavern
column5: supposedly shot "just moments after" the original cinematics end."

wowinfo: February 2014: World of Warcraft reaches 7.8 million players!

November 2014: Blizzcon 2014 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. Since the expansion is pretty close to release, there is not much news for WoW this time around. The convention focuses on their new IP, Overwatch and the movie Looking for Group". Attendees still got a goodie bag

March 2014: Pre-orders for the Warlords of Draenor expansion are open, as well as introducing the Character Boost service. For the a fee, you can instantly level up a character the to the highest level, as pre-ordering Warlords of Draenor will grant you a free Boost for a single character.
March 2014: The [Hearthsteed] mount is introduced as a promotion to mark the launch of Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft, Blizzard`s new TCG online card game.

November 2014: In anticipation of the release of Warlords of Draenor, A New York taxi cab is placed with a gigantic Gorehowl embedded in its roof was placed in Times Square, New York! A broken roof-top advert for Warlords of Draenor is found next to the cab, while the side of the cab advertises Flat fare Draenor" and "The Iron Horde is coming". The cab also bears the number plate WRCRFT and has the Iron Horde logo emblazoned on its hood.

wowday: 12,2014,August 2014: Following the death of comedian and actor Robin Williams
wowdate: known to have himself been a player of World of Warcraft and Warcraft III
wowinfo: on August 12th
column4: following assurances from CM Celestalon and Williams fan Brian Holinka
column5: the official World of Warcraft twitter account tweets ".@robinwilliams Thank you. You gave us so much joy in our lives
column6: and we hope you enjoyed your time in our world. We’ll see you in-game." The message is widely taken as confirmation of the creation of an in-game tribute."

wowinfo: November 2014: For the first time in several years, many players experience queues to get into the game, some showing backups of thousands of players and hours of waiting. Debate on fansites are confused if this is due to Blizzard not having enough servers or a continuation of the DDoS attack.

November 2014: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor is released! The level cap is raised to 100, introducing Draenor, the land before it became corrupt and turned into the ruins of Outland. Along with new dungeons and the Ashran PvP area, players are now able to build and customize their own garrison.

December 2014: Venturing through the base of the Gorian Empire, Paragon encounters the Ogre Mage and current ruler of Highmaul, Imperator Mar'gok. Upon his defeat at the hands of Paragon of Lightning's Blade-EU, the evil orge warlock, Cho'gall, interrupts the fight, slays Mar'gok, and proceeds to fight Paragon, only to fall under their might!

November 2014: For the first time in several years, many players experience queues to get into the game, some showing backups of thousands of players and hours of waiting. Debate on fansites are confused if this is due to Blizzard not having enough servers or a continuation of the DDoS attack.
August 2014: Blizzard debuts the Warlords of Draenor cinematic at GamesCom 2014, and announces a release date of November 13th.

October 2014: Patch 6.0.2 is released, as the Iron Horde invades the Blasted Lands! With the arrival of the new horde, from the Dark Portal, new character models have arrived, as well as skirmishes and an inventory update to sort toys and items via banks or the interface. Guild advancements are removed, and Auction Houses are not Unified for each realm, combining the previously separate Horde, Alliance, and Neutral Auction House.

November 2014: For the first time in several years, many players experience queues to get into the game, some showing backups of thousands of players and hours of waiting. Debate on fansites are confused if this is due to Blizzard not having enough servers or a continuation of the DDoS attack.

November 2014: For the first time in several years, many players experience queues to get into the game, some showing backups of thousands of players and hours of waiting. Debate on fansites are confused if this is due to Blizzard not having enough servers or a continuation of the DDoS attack.
November 2014: Gorehowl crashes into Shanghai, China. Gorehowl is much bigger than the one in New York. The area is cordoned off with tape that reads www.wowchina.com.
February 2014: Patch 5.4.7 is released, preparing for the upcoming Warlords of Draenor Collector`s Edition and retiring the Scroll of Resurrection.

November 2014: It is announced that Warlords of Draenor sold 3.3 million box copies (the majority of players had pre-ordered digitally) and the subscriber base was back up to 10 million! An incredible high, to levels of that of Wrath of the Lich King.
May 2014: Patch 5.4.8 is released, which is just a minor patch that increases the max upgrade level from +8 to +16. I have no idea what this means.

June 2014: The player Doubleagent becomes the first neutral pandaren character to reach level cap (90). He achieved this without ever leaving the starting area and only mining or picking herbs for experience points. He began in 2012, and his time played on reaching 90 was over 170 days.
November 2014: World of Warcraft turned 10 years old! Players are awarded WoW`s 10th Anniversary" achievement
column4: along with the [Molten Corgi] battle pet. Alongside with the standard awards for each anniversary
column5: players can participate in the temporary battleground: Tarren Mill vs. Southshore. Players can also experience one of the first raids in the original World of Warcraft release
column6: Molten Core (revamped to handle the current year but still mostly preserved from its original counterpart)."

wowinfo: June 2014: Warlords of Draenor enters beta testing!
September 2015: Patch 6.2.2 is released, allowing players who completed the Draenor Pathfinder" achievement can now fly in Draenor after 9+ months of being grounded."

February 2015: The Blackrock Foundry opens its gates, as Blackhand and his weaponry stands before you for Normal and Heroic difficulty. The Fiery Bird, Rukhmar, starts to fly around the Spires of Arak, taking a dedicated group of heroes to fight such a beast.
February 2015: The former writers of WoW Insider open a new website, Blizzard Watch.

August 2015: Blizzard announces that subscriptions in the second quarter of 2015 dropped to 5.6 million in 8 months - the lowest since 2005 and the sharpest decline yet, but still posted better than expected financial results"."
August 2015: As announced before, Blizzard announces their newest expansion, World of Warcraft: Legion, in GamesCom 2015.

November 2015: Blizzcon 2015 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. Previews of Legion content were covered in panels on the main stage as the expansion is still being made. Attendees received a goodie bag, rewarding a [Murkidan] mini-pet which resembles Illidan Stormrage.
November 2015: Blog posts are shown for the next few days, giving users a general idea of how Blizzard wants to handle each of the 11 classes. Today was the introduction and overview.
November 2015: Blog posts are shown for the next few days, giving users a general idea of how Blizzard wants to handle each of the 11 classes. Today's classes are: Hunter, Mage, Priest.
November 2015: Blog posts are shown for the next few days, giving users a general idea of how Blizzard wants to handle each of the 11 classes. Today's classes are: Death Knight, Paladin, Warlock.
November 2015: Blog posts are shown for the next few days, giving users a general idea of how Blizzard wants to handle each of the 11 classes. Today's classes are: Monk, Shaman, Warrior.
November 2015: Blog posts are shown for the next few days, giving users a general idea of how Blizzard wants to handle each of the 11 classes. Today's classes are: Druid, Rogue.

July 2015: The High Commander of the Burning Legion, Archimonde, falls once more within the Hellfire Citadel by the hands of Serenity, from Twisting Nether-EU. Gul'dan`s plan is thwarted and sent to a portal for another chance to succeed.
November 2015: Patch 6.2.3 is released, introducing cross-realm Mythic raiding, the introduction to Timewalking dungeons (Cataclysm to be exact) and the re-introduction of Valor and item upgrading.

February 2015: After Method, of Twisting Nether-EU, traversed through Blackrock Foundry, ending many of its functionalities, the leader of the Blackrock Clan and Chief of the Foundry, Blackhand, assaulted the mighty guild, only to fall onto the hardened magma he created.

June 2015: Patch 6.2.0 is released, unlocking the Tanaan Jungle zone and introducing garrison shipyards. The fel-consumed fortress of Hellfire Citadel opens its doors for normal and heroic difficulty, as Gul'dan attempts to establish a foothold for his new army.
November 2015: Legion Alpha begins!
February 2015: Patch 6.1.0 is released, updating the Blood Elf character model and adding the Heirloom collections tab.
July 2015: In a break from tradition, Blizzard announces that the next expansion will be revealed at Gamescom 2015.
January 2015: In an AOL restructuring eliminating less-profitable sites, WoW Insider closes up after nine years.
February 2016: Blizzard`s 25th Anniversary!!!
November 2016: Helya`s Guarddog of Hellheim, Guarm, is put to sleep by the courageous valor of Limit from Illidan-US.
November 2016: Odyn`s Trials, in order to see who among us is worthy enough to take on Helya, have found SNF from Sargeras-US to be the first to be deemed worthy for the task at hand!
April 2016: Legion's release date is announced to release in August 30th, 2016.
November 2016: Helya`s vengeance and reign is lost is the sea of souls, thanks to the heroes of the guild Method, from Tarren Mill-EU!
July 2016: Patch 7.0.3 is released, implementing the new transmogrification system and abilities/talents revamp. The Legion begins to invade all around Azeroth, destroying the land and causing havoc!

October 2016: Patch 7.1 is released, introducing new world quests, mounts, and the Nightfallen insurrection quest campaign. The Legion forces are attempting to make a base in Karazhan, as we must return to the once-abandoned castle to stop their plans. At the same time, Oydn has given us a chance to prove our worth and the opportunity to take care of Helya once and for all in the Trial of Valor raid instance.
September 2016: The feral bear, Ursoc, is tamed and skinned by the hands of Midwinter from Sargeras-US.
September 2016: The corrupted druid, Elerethe Renferal, is put to rest by Easy of Aerie Peak-US within the Emerald Nightmare.
September 2016: The decaying dragon, Nythendra, falls and crumbles during the fight with Easy of Aerie Peak-US for the first time.
September 2016: The Dragons of Nightmare awaken to death from Midwinter from Sargeras-US, as their spirits leave the haunting nightmare realm.
September 2016: Rejoice, the end of Ilgynoth came soon when met with Экзорсус of Howling Fjord-EU. He now journeys to Nyalotha.
September 2016: The corrupted Demigod, Cenarius, was taught a lesson by Экзорсус of Howling Fjord-EU. Hopefully he will be purified once more.
September 2016: The ambitious, corrupted, and ugly Satyr, Xavius, breaths his last within the Emerald Nightmare. This great deed was done with the people of Экзорсус of Howling Fjord-EU.

August 2016: World of Warcraft: Legion expansion launches globally! The level cap is increased to 110, while we begin to establish a base of operations within the Broken Isles. Along with new dungeons and the new Demon Hunter class, we notice the pathway to the Emerald Nightmare raid open, as corrupted horrors have been expecting our arrival.

November 2017: Blizzcon 2017 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. The announcement and cinematic for World of Warcraft`s newst expansion, Battle for Azeroth, was announced, as well as the reveal of World of Warcraft: Classic. Attendees of the convention, either in person or online, were given an Alliance/Horde-themed mount.

February 2017: The malicious warlock, Gul'dan is defeated at the top of the Nighthold! Such a feat was accomplished by the guild Экзорсус of Howling Fjord-EU!!! They were even able to slay the newly-created avatar of Sargeras, possessing the body of Illidan Stormrage!

November 2017: Blizzcon 2017 takes place in the Anaheim Convention Center, California. The announcement and cinematic for World of Warcraft`s newst expansion, Battle for Azeroth, was announced, as well as the reveal of World of Warcraft: Classic. Attendees of the convention, either in person or online, were given an Alliance/Horde-themed mount.
July 2017: The reanimated avatar of Sargeras is met with a climatic end once Method, of Tarren Mill-EU, ready themselves.
December 2017: The inventor of the war machines, Kin-garoth, was ruined by the hands of Limit from US-Illidan.
December 2017: Limit from US-illidan has calculated the odds of Antoran High Command`s survival in Mythic difficulty: 0!
December 2017: The notorious bounty hunter, Imonar, was taken out by Limit of US-Illidan before he could collect his bounty.
December 2017: The Life-Binder`s essence is freed from the grasps of the Burning Legion due to the heroism of Limit from US-Illidan.
December 2017: As the gates to Antorus open, the war machine, Garothi Worldbreaker, was torn to pieces by the might of Big Dumb Guild from US-Illidan.

December 2017: Deep within the stronghold, the master of portals that would aid the legion in conquering worlds through the Great Dark Beyond, Hasabel, was decimated by the actions of Limit from US-Illidan.
December 2017: Twisting the minds of the fallen titans, The Coven of Shivarra were unable to meet their goals of the Dark Pantheon due to Limit's (from US-Illidan) heroism.
December 2017: After his failure during the Third War, Varimathras, punished and broken beyond belief, fights to avenage his failings against Limit from US-Illidan...only to fail for the last time.
December 2017: Reborn as the titan of destruction, not even Aggramar and his burning blade, Taeshalach, could withstand the might of Method from Tarren Mill-EU.

January 2017: Patch 7.1.5 is released, opening Suramar`s famed palace, The Nighthold, as Gul'dan is attempting to corrupt the Nightborne and bring his leader into our world. The Brawler's Guild also returns, as Mist of Pandaria Timewalking dungeons and Micro-Holidays are introduced.
June 2017: Patch 7.2.5 is released, adding new Micro-Holidays, the Trial of Style holiday event, and the Death of Chromie scenario!

December 2017: The titan of Argus, corrupted and droven to insanity by Sargeras, finally falls to the triumphant Method of Tarren Mill-EU! Sargeras crusade finally comes to an end, as we leave with his final bout against the betrayer, Illidan Stormrage.

July 2017: The high commander of the Burning Legion, the Deceiver Kil'Jaeden, is cut short within his own flagship! This act of valor, thanks to Method of Tarren Mill-EU, opens the gateway to Argus, setting up for whats to come!
June 2017: We are finally ready to finish the fight with the Legion, as The Tomb of Sargeras raid instance finally opens. Kil'Jaeden awaits us at his Flagship!
January 2017: The hardened scorpion, Skorpyron, crumbles beneath the might of SNF of Sargeras, US!
January 2017: SNF from Sargeras-US continues their dominance with the elimination of the dysfunctional robot, Trilliax!
January 2017: The Arcane Amalgamation, Chromatic Anomaly, disappears for the first time as SNF from Sargeras, US proceeds forward.
January 2017: The doom lord slayer of Tirion Fordring, Krosus, crumbles at the might of Limit of Illidan-US!
January 2017: The High Botanist Telarn is cut short for the first time with the help of Serenity of Twisting Nether-EU!
January 2017: The leader of the Nathrezim, Tichondrius, could not fool Limit of Illidan-US! The demon fails his tasks and is sent back to the Twisting Nether.
June 2017: The big, dumb, Naga brute, Harjatan, is beaten by Big Dumb Guild of Illidan-US!
June 2017: Easy, from Aerie Peak-US, found it quite easy to defeat the two jailing brothers, Demonic Inquisition!
June 2017: Despite their deaths a millennia ago, the Sisters of the moons vigil ends at the hands of Big Dumb Guild of Illidan-US.
June 2017: Easy, from Aerie Peak-US, shows how easy it is to defeat a demon like Goroth, considering this the World First Mythic Kill!
January 2017: The stars align, showing a future where Star Augur Etraeus is no more! This prophecy was brought to life thanks to Serenity from Twisting Nether-EU.

March 2017: Patch 7.2 is released, as we take the fight to the Legion onto the Broken Shore! While the fight eventually leads us to the Tomb of Sargeras raid, we are still making preparations and must fend off constant Legion Assaults in the Broken Isles. Yet the Cathedral of Eternal Night dungeon is accessible! Flying also becomes available to those who completed the designated achievements.
June 2017: The collection of tainted souls, the Desolate Host, is finally freed from the fel-energies that possessed it, thanks to Big Dumb Guild, of Illidan-US!
June 2017: The high commander of the Naga and denizens of the ocean, Mistress Sassz'ine, fails her mission to obtain the relic thanks to the experience and might of Method, from Tarren Mill-EU!
August 2017: Patch 7.3 Shadow of Argus" is released on US realms. This patchs brings us to a new world called Argus
column4: as well as a new Dungeon (Seat of ther Triumvirate) and a new raid (Antorus
column5: The Burning Throne) at a later date. The patch updated the relic system via the Netherlight Crucible
column7: and invasion points throughout the new world."

wowinfo: June 2017: Corrupted Guardian of the Tomb, The Maiden of Vigilance is relieved of her duty with the help of the guild Method, of Tarren Mill-EU.

November 2017: Antorus, The Burning Throne is broken through for Normal and Heroic Difficulties! Ascend through the Legion`s main fortress to fight through horrors, commanders, and titans! Your calculations of survival: 0!
January 2017: Time has shifted again and again and again! Yet, no matter how many iterations, Grand Magistrix Elisande falls from the might of Serenity of Twisting Nether-EU!
December 2017: Sargeras` favorite dogs, the Felhounds, were put down by the guild Limit`s cruel actions  from US-Illidan.
